meanings.sent1: After the storm, the sailors revictualed their ship with fresh supplies.
meanings.sent2: The hikers revictualed their backpacks before embarking on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The picnic basket was revictualed with tasty snacks, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness revictualed his heart with warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The garden was revictualed with colorful flowers, brightening up the yard.

meanings.definition: To provide with food or supplies again.
meanings.sent1: The kind neighbor revictualed the family with groceries after their house fire.
meanings.sent2: The campers revictualed their cooler with ice for the weekend trip.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine was revictualed with snacks, much to the delight of the students.
meanings.sent4: Her words revictualed his spirit with hope during difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The bird feeder was revictualed with seeds, attracting colorful visitors to the garden.
